chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl A. Ruwe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence w/held probation 3 years - 1 year county jail with huber and good time - Fine/costs $2122.00 - DL revoked 36 months - IID 36 months - absolute sobriety -AODA and any follow thru restitution to Element Fleet Management hearing scheduled for 7/19/17 at 9:30 - consecutive to Columbia County case 03 CF 399  - to consult with a Doctor with a pharmaceutical approach on dealing with his alcohol addiction - counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in
Consecutive to: Columbia county Case 03 CF 399
DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
On any vehicle owned or operated.

records.addlTxt: Proposed Income Assignment Order for Unpaid Fines and Other Financial Obligations
Doc 75 erased - clerical error
of sentencing after revocation November 20 2020
revoked 6-23-2020

9:59 AM  Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County. Defendant Darrell A. Ruwe in court by video from custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Christian J Ness appearing by phone on revocation cases and Ryan Reid appearing by video for 20CF99.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video.  Court calls cases 15CF131, 16CF143 and 20CF99.   Atty Poquette makes statement regarding error on PSI regarding max sentence in reference to dismissed repeater charge.  Atty Poquette states parties have joint agreement on all cases.  DE states he approves of video appearance. 
Atty Poquette recites the agreement, both DE counsel and Defendant agree with statement.  Joint agreement is the same sentence for two revocation cases 15CF131 & 16CF143:  3 years prison consisting of 18 months initial confinement, 18 months ext supervison, to run concurrent with each other.  Agreement in 20CF99: 12 years prison consisting of 6 years initial confinement, 6 years extended supervision consecutive to revocation cases 15CF131 & 16CF143.
Atty Poquette makes statement;  general public is the victim in these cases.
10:10 am Atty Ness makes statement.  10:15 am Atty Reid makes statement.  DE declines comment.
10:16 AM COURT:  Accepts the joint agreement.  Court sentences:
15CF131:  3 years prison:  18 months initial confinement, 18 months extended supervision  
16CF143  3 years prison: 18 months initial confinement, 18 months extended supervision Concurrent with 15CF131
20CF99: 12 years prison:  6 years initial confinement, 6 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to 15CF131 and 16CF143

Extended supervision conditions on all 3 cases:  Absolute sobriety; Cognitive behavioral programming and any other counselling as directed by DOC; Random urinalysis; 

Atty Poquette makes statement regarding complicated jail credit issue; Atty Ness responds; Atty Reid declines comment.   Atty Poquette makes further comment, agrees with 229 days credit, has questions regarding conditional jail time credit as has no verification regarding time actually served.
COURT:  Credit 229 days plus 56 plus 21 totalling:  306 DAYS CREDIT on each revocation case, concurrent.  NO credit on 20CF229.  If Atty Ness finds more credit to apply, JOC can be amended.  
Defendant corrects the spelling of his first name on the record- correct spelling is Darryl and middle name is Arthur.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 20, 2020 at 10:00 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Darryl Arthur Ruwe in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid. Attorney Christine Ness appears by telephone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County.  Court calls 20CF99, 15CF131 and 16CF143.  Attny Ness makes statement to court.   Court adjourns to track with 20CF99  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 20, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 9, 2020 at 10:30 am.

03:34 PM Defendant Darryl Arthur Ruwe in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid and Attorney Christian Ness, appears by video conferencing.  Defendant Darryl Arthur Ruwe in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County.    Appearances through zoom due to the Supreme Court Order regarding the Public Health Crisis of COVID-19.   Court calls 20CF99, 16CF143 and 15CF131.    Attny Reid makes statement, global agreement reached, working with State and Attny Ness on sentence credit for the revocation cases 16CF143 and 15CF131.   All parties agree global resolution reached, and request new date for plea/sentencing.  Bond Continues.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 9, 2020 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 14, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

09:20 AM Defendant Darrell A. Ruwe in court with attorney Christian J Ness appearing by telephone.  Defendant Darrell A. Ruwe in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County. Court calls the cases 16CF143 and 15CF131.     OFF THE RECORD: 9:22 AM Court places DEF and Attorney in breakout room for discussion.     BACK ON THE RECORD:  9:27 AM  - Court resumes session.    Attny Ness indicates global resolution, request reset for clarification on jail credit.  State no objection to reset.   Bond Continues.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 14, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

State recites plea agreement - 15 CF 131 - NC OWI 5th balance of counts DRI - probation 3 years - 1 yr county jail - $2122.00 - DL revoked 36 mo - IID 36 months - restitution Element Fleet Mgmt  - Absolute sobriety - AODA - consecutive in Columbia county case 03 CF 399   /  16 CF 143 - NC to plea - probation 3 yrs consecutive to 03 CF 399 and concurrent to 15 CF 131 - AODA - costs -     16 CF 164 to be dismissed. Combined Bond $1000 ($700 Cash Bond and $300 Signature Bond)    
SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
